summary.long: 1 Peter is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the elect who are sojourners of the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, in sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace be multiplied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to his great mercy begat us again unto a living hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto an inheritance incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away, reserved in heaven for you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who by the power of God are guarded through faith unto a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a little while, if need be, ye have been put to grief in manifold trials,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the proof of your faith, being more precious than gold that perisheth though it is proved by fire, may be found unto praise and glory and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom not having seen ye love; on whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice greatly with joy unspeakable and full of glory:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: receiving the end of your faith, even the salvation of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Concerning which salvation the prophets sought and searched diligently, who prophesied of the grace that should come unto you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: searching what time or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did point unto, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glories that should follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To whom it was revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto you, did they minister these things, which now have been announced unto you through them that preached the gospel unto you by the Holy Spirit sent forth from heaven; which things angels desire to look into.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore girding up the loins of your mind, be sober and set your hope perfectly on the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as children of obedience, not fashioning yourselves according to your former lusts in the time of your ignorance:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but like as he who called you is holy, be ye yourselves also holy in all manner of living;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it is written, Ye shall be holy; for I am holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if ye call on him as Father, who without respect of persons judgeth according to each manâ€™s work, pass the time of your sojourning in fear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that ye were redeemed, not with corruptible things, with silver or gold, from your vain manner of life handed down from your fathers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but with precious blood, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot, even the blood of Christ:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who was foreknown indeed before the foundation of the world, but was manifested at the end of the times for your sake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who through him are believers in God, that raised him from the dead, and gave him glory; so that your faith and hope might be in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Seeing ye have purified your souls in your obedience to the truth unto unfeigned love of the brethren, love one another from the heart fervently:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having been begotten again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, through the word of God, which liveth and abideth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For,
All flesh is as grass,
And all the glory thereof as the flower of grass.
The grass withereth, and the flower falleth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the word of the Lord abideth for ever.
And this is the word of good tidings which was preached unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Putting away therefore all wickedness, and all guile, and hypocrisies, and envies, and all evil speakings,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as newborn babes, long for the spiritual milk which is without guile, that ye may grow thereby unto salvation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if ye have tasted that the Lord is gracious:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: unto whom coming, a living stone, rejected indeed of men, but with God elect, precious,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ye also, as living stones, are built up a spiritual house, to be a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because it is contained in scripture,
Behold, I lay in Zion a chief corner stone, elect, precious:
And he that believeth on him shall not be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: But ye are an elect race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for Godâ€™s own possession, that ye may show forth the excellencies of him who called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who in time past were no people, but now are the people of God: who had not obtained mercy, but now have obtained mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, I beseech you as sojourners and pilgrims, to abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having your behavior seemly among the Gentiles; that, wherein they speak against you as evil-doers, they may by your good works, which they behold, glorify God in the day of visitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be subject to every ordinance of man for the Lordâ€™s sake: whether to the king, as supreme;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: or unto governors, as sent by him for vengeance on evil-doers and for praise to them that do well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For so is the will of God, that by well-doing ye should put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as free, and not using your freedom for a cloak of wickedness, but as bondservants of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Honor all men. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honor the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Servants, be in subjection to your masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the froward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is acceptable, if for conscience toward God a man endureth griefs, suffering wrongfully.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what glory is it, if, when ye sin, and are buffeted for it, ye shall take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer for it, ye shall take it patiently, this is acceptable with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For hereunto were ye called: because Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an example, that ye should follow his steps:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who, when he was reviled, reviled not again; when he suffered, threatened not; but committed himself to him that judgeth righteously:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who his own self bare our sins in his body upon the tree, that we, having died unto sins, might live unto righteousness; by whose stripes ye were healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For ye were going astray like sheep; but are now returned unto the Shepherd and Bishop of your souls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In like manner, ye wives, be in subjection to your own husbands; that, even if any obey not the word, they may without the word be gained by the behavior of their wives;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: beholding your chaste behavior coupled with fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whose adorning let it not be the outward adorning of braiding the hair, and of wearing jewels of gold, or of putting on apparel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but let it be the hidden man of the heart, in the incorruptible apparel of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of God of great price.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For after this manner aforetime the holy women also, who hoped in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection to their own husbands:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord: whose children ye now are, if ye do well, and are not put in fear by any terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ye husbands, in like manner, dwell with your wives according to knowledge, giving honor unto the woman, as unto the weaker vessel, as being also joint-heirs of the grace of life; to the end that your prayers be not hindered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, be ye all likeminded, compassionate, loving as brethren, tenderhearted, humbleminded:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not rendering evil for evil, or reviling for reviling; but contrariwise blessing; for hereunto were ye called, that ye should inherit a blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For,
He that would love life,
And see good days,
Let him refrain his tongue from evil,
And his lips that they speak no guile:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And let him turn away from evil, and do good;
Let him seek peace, and pursue it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous,
And his ears unto their supplication:
But the face of the Lord is upon them that do evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And who is he that will harm you, if ye be zealous of that which is good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even if ye should suffer for righteousnessâ€™ sake, blessed are ye: and fear not their fear, neither be troubled;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but sanctify in your hearts Christ as Lord: being ready always to give answer to every man that asketh you a reason concerning the hope that is in you, yet with meekness and fear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: having a good conscience; that, wherein ye are spoken against, they may be put to shame who revile your good manner of life in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is better, if the will of God should so will, that ye suffer for well-doing than for evil-doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Christ also suffered for sins once, the righteous for the unrighteous, that he might bring us to God; being put to death in the flesh, but made alive in the spirit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in which also he went and preached unto the spirits in prison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that aforetime were disobedient, when the longsuffering of God waited in the days of Noah, while the ark was a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls, were saved through water:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: which also after a true likeness doth now save you, even baptism, not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the interrogation of a good conscience toward God, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who is on the right hand of God, having gone into heaven; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Forasmuch then as Christ suffered in the flesh, arm ye yourselves also with the same mind; for he that hath suffered in the flesh hath ceased from sin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that ye no longer should live the rest of your time in the flesh to the lusts of men, but to the will of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time past may suffice to have wrought the desire of the Gentiles, and to have walked in lasciviousness, lusts, winebibbings, revellings, carousings, and abominable idolatries:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wherein they think it strange that ye run not with them into the same excess of riot, speaking evil of you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who shall give account to him that is ready to judge the living and the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For unto this end was the gospel preached even to the dead, that they might be judged indeed according to men in the flesh, but live according to God in the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore of sound mind, and be sober unto prayer:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: above all things being fervent in your love among yourselves; for love covereth a multitude of sins:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: using hospitality one to another without murmuring:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: according as each hath received a gift, ministering it among yourselves, as good stewards of the manifold grace of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if any man speaketh, speaking as it were oracles of God; if any man ministereth, ministering as of the strength which God supplieth: that in all things God may be glorified through Jesus Christ, whose is the glory and the dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial among you, which cometh upon you to prove you, as though a strange thing happened unto you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but insomuch as ye are partakers of Christâ€™s sufferings, rejoice; that at the revelation of his glory also ye may rejoice with exceeding joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If ye are reproached for the name of Christ, blessed are ye; because the Spirit of glory and the Spirit of God resteth upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For let none of you suffer as a murderer, or a thief, or an evil-doer, or as a meddler in other menâ€™s matters:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but if a man suffer as a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God in this name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the time is come for judgment to begin at the house of God: and if it begin first at us, what shall be the end of them that obey not the gospel of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if the righteous is scarcely saved, where shall the ungodly and sinner appear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore let them also that suffer according to the will of God commit their souls in well-doing unto a faithful Creator.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The elders therefore among you I exhort, who am a fellow-elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, who am also a partaker of the glory that shall be revealed:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Tend the flock of God which is among you, exercising the oversight, not of constraint, but willingly, according to the will of God; nor yet for filthy lucre, but of a ready mind;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: neither as lording it over the charge allotted to you, but making yourselves ensamples to the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the chief Shepherd shall be manifested, ye shall receive the crown of glory that fadeth not away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, ye younger, be subject unto the elder. Yea, all of you gird yourselves with humility, to serve one another: for God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace to the humble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: casting all your anxiety upon him, because he careth for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be sober, be watchful: your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion, walketh about, seeking whom he may devour:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom withstand stedfast in your faith, knowing that the same sufferings are accomplished in your brethren who are in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the God of all grace, who called you unto his eternal glory in Christ, after that ye have suffered a little while, shall himself perfect, establish, strengthen you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To him be the dominion for ever and ever. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By Silvanus, our faithful brother, as I account him, I have written unto you briefly, exhorting, and testifying that this is the true grace of God: stand ye fast therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She that is in Babylon, elect together with you, saluteth you; and so doth Mark my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Salute one another with a kiss of love.
Peace be unto you all that are in Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator
